system.description:
Your Telekinesis grants you the following benefits:

Limited Telekinesis: You are able to use your mind to easily move objects around you. When you take the Object Action, you can interact with an object up to 5 lbs (2.5 kg) that is within 5 Spaces. You can manipulate objects, open doors or containers, etc.

Combat Telekinesis: You gain access to the Grapple Maneuvers. When you make a Check as part of a Shove Action, Grapple Action, Grapple Maneuver, or to escape a Grapple, you can make a Spell Check instead. When you do, you use the following changes:

  • Size: Your size is considered Medium for the purposes of the Check.

  • Range: You can target creatures within 5 Spaces.

  • Grapple Action: While Grappling a creature, you can choose to move normally, but the target doesn't move with you. You can Grapple up to 2 creatures in this way at a time.

  • Shove Action: You can Shove a creature in any direction of your choice. This Feature doesn’t grant you the ability to Shove yourself.

  • Throw Maneuver: You use your Prime Modifier instead of your Might to determine the distance thrown. Additionally, you throw the creature from its Space instead of your own.

  • Body Block Maneuver: The target must be within 1 Space of you.

 

Action Point Enhancements

You can choose to spend additional AP when you take the Shove Action or perform the Throw Maneuver but before making the Spell Check. You can choose multiple effects or the same effect multiple times. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the target only makes 1 Save against all effects.

  • Push: (1 AP) The target is Pushed up to 1 additional Space (requires the Shove Action or Throw Maneuver).
  • Rend Body: (1 AP) The target’s PD is reduced by 2 until the end of your next turn.

 

Mana Point Enhancement

You can spend 1 or more MP (up to your Combat Mastery) before you make the Spell Check to choose 2 additional AP Enhancements.

 

System Tip: Use that feature instead of rolling maneuvers and Actions. This feature is configured as a contest between your Spell Check and enemy Martial Check.
